reviews.text: Nice family style restaurant run by a friendly uncle and auntie. Food is tasty and has good portion. Price reasonable. Would recommend.

Got a good shock from this place, I wasn't expecting much from this establishment. I'm pretty surprised by the quality of the sashimi. I would say, you could definitely give this place a shot if you haven't tried. It's a little cram, but the food makes up for that.
Sashimi is thick-cut and sweet! The service is also very good. I will come back again to try other menu! üòÅ

POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!
If I can give 0 star, I would. Pretty disappointed since we liked the food previously. Let me type it again, really bad service!!!
Passed by after an evening walk with my girlfriend.
She enquire if the shop is still open, an uncle, who seemed to be the owner since his photos are everything in the cashier, said, ‚ÄúWE‚ÄôRE CLOSE CLOSE! WE HAVE WAITING LIST!!‚Äù
Upon witnessing on the situation that is unfolding in front of me, I entered and approached the auntie and said, ‚ÄúI know the place is fully book but the uncle doesn‚Äôt need to be so rude to my girlfriend‚Äù. The uncle came out from the kitchen and said, ‚ÄúWE ARE ALREADY CLOSE!‚Äù right in front of the customers! We were there at about 815 pm since we know that the last order is at 930 pm.
If you want returning customers, please be nice to them! Just because we‚Äôre not Singaporean Chinese, doesn‚Äôt mean you should be treating people like that! You need to be open to every race especially if you want to build good relationships with customers! Terrible!! If you and your colleagues are tired, kindly place the operating sign as CLOSE!!!
Thanks to you, I have finally opened a blog about worst restaurants in Holland Village. There‚Äôs not much. You‚Äôre number 1! Will be spreading the word to all my friends. Really terrible üò¢

I almost hesitate to write a review here, because I don't want it to become another impossible-to-get-a-reservation restaurant. But it definitely would be in that category if it was in a more visible location.

The sushi is honestly really good, really fresh, really flavorful, and really reasonably-priced for the quality. I've had a few other dishes, and they're all good as well. Plus the people are really nice and attentive.

data.body: Goro Japanese Cuisine serves premium quality Japanese Cuisine at affordable price in the heartland. Visit us at 43 Holland Drive and enjoy our 1FOR1 sashimi served by our master chef with 40 years experience!
data.description: Goro Japanese Cuisine serves premium quality Japanese Cuisine at affordable price in the heartland. Visit us at 43 Holland Drive and enjoy our 1FOR1 sashimi served by our master chef with 40 years experience!
data.name: Goro Japanese Cuisine

reviews.text: Authentic Japanese Izakaya experience with a good selection of drinks such as Shochu, Chu-Hi and Highballs. Also available are Draft Beers as well as a large selection of dining options. Non-Alcoholic options also available.
Attentive staff and food is really flavorful. The music/ambience reminds me of hidden Izakayas in Shinjuku. Lunch sets are very affordable.
Generous amount of food worth the price and great service. Defiantly coming back here
Feels I'm transported back to Japan in this Authentic izakaya. Food is yummy and real Japanese taste
Cosy and quaint spot. Cheap Sapporo beer at $6.50 per mug! Loved the hokke set

data.body: Raku Raku is a Japanese restaurant located in the rustic charms the Duxton hill area. Serving food with a philosophy of passion and sincerity, diners can expect simple but delicious and authentic Japanese fare in a heartwarming, homely restaurant setting in Raku Raku.
data.description: Description
data.name: Raku Raku Japanese Dining

reviews.text: What a delightful experience. The wait for tables was very well managed, service staff was very helpful and attentive ( such a pleasant surprise given how packed they were). We tried multiple dishes and all were exceptional. This is a place certainly worth the wait.
The service team here is amazing! Great attention to detail and comical. Love their energy! Food quality is equal to that! Gotta give the Premium Crab Soba with Ajitama (Add-on) a go.

My first visit to this outlet at Jewel Changi yesterday. The noodles quality is great n the food are nice.. What really impress me is the service of the staffs even though there is only 1 staff at the floor n the other behind the counter. Especially the lady Akira who is very bubbly n cheerful all the time.. Its her lively attitude that greatly enhance my dining experience in this outlet n of course my appetite as well.. Kudos to the staffs service.. Well Done!

First time trying out Ramen at this restaurant.

Very worth the rating :)

Plus point is the services at this outlet. Even if the food is not good , good services compensate it. But the food here is good.

Good services meaning the staff is very attentive to our needs.

Knowing we are sharing a bowl of ramen even offer us two sharing bowls.

And asked if we need any drinks

I saw a family came in with kids, and straightaway they took baby utensils out , with a scissor too for them to cut noodles.

Very attentive üòâüíØüíØüíØ

Will definitely come back again!
Great food, very affordable price, more for casual dining. Low seating. Quite fast serving. Quite thoughtful that they provide scissor and kids cutlery without need to request.

data.body: Tsuta Japanese Soba Noodles has the honour of being the World‚Äôs first ramen eatery to receive a Michelin Star. Helmed by Chef Yuki Onishi who was determined to redefine the classic experience sans artificial ingredients or MSG, you can be assured that every dish is made with premium, fresh and natural produce. With a focus on creating original flavour profiles revolving around the soup stock (dashi), every bowl of noodles is guaranteed to be top notch and cooked with the utmost care and skill.
data.description: Tsuta Japanese Soba Noodles (Jewel)
data.name: Tsuta Japanese Soba Noodles (Jewel)

reviews.text: Nice eel, fresh and you can see how they process the live eel.. Fast services.. A good treat once in a while if you are an Unagi lover!! Due to Covid-19, now the dining time is restricted to 40 minutes.. So might not be convenient for those slow eaters and want to slowly enjoy but is okay for me since I can eat quite fastüòÇ

One friend introduced this nice place.  Be honestly the fish by hand made taste really delicious.  We really enjoy this place.  If you want save time.  Try come early.  Usually need queue.  There no make reservations only walk in.  Service is good too. Recommend
My mum like the man man
Always good if there is no queue.

The atmosphere is good, the food is good, service is good, the price is reasonable. However, there is a set dining time of 40 minutes, while it is understandable yet, we feel we have been rushed. As soon as we finished dining, the server comes to collect the plates. I would have wish it will be slightly different. At least 1 hour or 1.15 hours and don't collect until the time is up. This will put the customer at ease and not feeling pressured.

The two stars minus are mainly for the unnecessary pressures. Hope to see this improved soon.

data.body: Man Man Japanese Unagi Restaurant offers some of the best Seafood and Japanese cuisine, serving a tantalising collection of dishes that are suitable for family gatherings, catching up with friends and colleagues. From Una Tama Don to Tamagoyaki its extensive menu is reflective of the restaurant‚Äôs efforts to cater to every palate. Man Man Japanese Unagi Restaurant is owned by renowned Chef Teppei Yamashita. Unagi is the Japanese word for freshwater eel. The eels they serve come from Mikawa Isshiki region.
data.description: Description
data.name: Man Man Japanese Unagi Restaurant

reviews.text: Serves a fully vegetarian/vegan spread of Japanese cuisine, tucked away in Fortune Centre. The space is super tight, so getting seats is often an issue during peak hours. Service is quick and efficient. The food is slightly on the pricier side, but worth it for the unique veg experience. A must-visit if you're in the area.

Atmosphere, tasty Japanese food with quite a few variety. Prices is not on the cheap side. Do make a reservation if dining on weekend or public holiday as seats are very limited.

Doesn't disappoint.
My friend recommend this place . First time trying and i am totally impressed that plant base diet can be so interesting. very yummy and will sure come back again to bring my family to try too.
One of best Japanese vegetarian restaurant in Singapore. Food tastes really good. Good service and on the top, no long waiting for food preparation. üëå
Love the fully vegetarian menu with plenty of vegan options! Every dish ordered was fully vegan with the same authentic Japanese flavours. Highly recommended!

data.body:
Vegetarian-friendly, Vegan-friendly, Jain-friendly

 For a Japanese meal beyond the usual vegetable-based ramen, avocado and cucumber sushi rolls, Herbivore‚Äôs vegan menu offers mock sushi (tuna, salmon, unagi (fresh water eel) and other dishes like natto soba (traditional Japanese noodles with fermented soybeans) and vegetarian tonkatsu (a dish with breaded, deep-fried vegetables). Located in Fortune Centre‚Äîa haven for vegetarian dining in Singapore due to the large number of meat-free eateries under one roof‚Äîthe restaurant is also Jain-friendly and does not use garlic and onion in its cooking.
data.pricing: Prices of √° la carte menu varies
data.description: Visitors can enjoy vegetarian tonkatsu of breaded, deep-fried vegetables and mock tuna, salmon and unagi sushi at this vegetarian restaurant with a twist.
data.name: Herbivore Japanese & Western Vegetarian Restaurant

reviews.text:
Bought vouchers from Chope which entitled us to a 45% discount on the Premium buffet, amount still totalled up to about $150 for two pax.

Without a doubt, restaurant serves up quality meats, with nice marbling on every slice. Other dishes were good too, and on days where it's not so crowded you'd be able to exceed the dining limit without a problem.

My only gripe would be actual price of the buffet. I wouldn't be able to pay up so much for a buffet without the 45% discount, and still enjoy my meal the way I did at such a high price point.

Our 3rd visit to Tenkaichi @ Marina Square. Love the ambience here as the restaurant is spacious and therefore not too crowded.
Opted for alfresco seating this time round and once again impressed by the food, service and environment.

I must say the staff were really attentive and helpful, they will check out on us from time to time to make sure if we need any help or to top up our drinks. Special thanks to one of the female staffs (didn‚Äôt get her name but she is the oldest among all), met her for all our 3 visits and her attitude is always very good and she is very hardworking as well, always see her walking in and out the kitchen and running between tables to attend to diners, thumbs up for her work attitude üëçüèª

Kudos to this restaurant, food served is of good quality and portion is generous too. Just order the amount you can eat as not to waste food ya :)

If i were not for the excellent and courteous service of the staff, I would have given this restaurant a 1-star rating only. The wagyu beef was not fresh, tuna sashimi cut was not quality sashimi, and oysters that were on the menu was not available. The "premium" buffet, SGD 282 for 2 people, does not deserve the "premium" name and certainly not worth the price. Very disappointing.

We have tried theirs ala carte set instead of buffet

Recommended their sushi platter

Premium price and Horrible service and experience .. order a set of bbq platter .. you dun even need to cook for us . Waited for more than 25 mins after being sited while people who came later than us got their food .
No acknowledgment of the waiting time let alone us and the place is like only 50 percent full. . Getting a glass of water seems like a chore as well

The response from the management said it all really  - ‚Äúblaming the wifi and stating it is just my bad luck my order didn‚Äôt appear lol ‚Äú
as stated the problem is you have staffs who were barely busy passing by us without one bothering to question why we were sat at the table for so long without even given a glass of water
A gentle warning to other diners !!

data.body:
A hidden gem amongst Singapore's thriving Japanese restaurant scene, Tenkaichi Japanese BBQ Restaurant specializes in Wagyu Beef Yakiniku using exquisite cuts of beef from Japan.

In addition to premium Kagoshima and Hokkaido wagyu, this restaurant also offers popular sashimi choices such as Salmon Belly, Sea Bream and Tuna.
data.description: Tenkaichi Japanese BBQ Restaurant (Marina Square)
data.name: Tenkaichi Japanese BBQ Restaurant (Marina Square)

reviews.text: Needs to do something about their service. Had a really good experience here 2 months ago so decided to dine at their establishment again. Called a month in advance to book a date but was told that they only take bookings a week in advance. Called exactly a week prior to booking and was told that they can fit me in on either the 6 or 630pm slot for expectant date so settled for 630pm. Upon hanging up, receptionist told me that I would be on a waiting list and they would call me back the next day. Follow up - Recep called to advise that they are fully booked on expectant day, was asked to advise on next available date and time, was just met with "we are fully booked, we have a lot of return customers". It feels like they don't need/ want anymore business. First of all, if you were fully booked, why did you offer slots? Why were you unable to advise on next available slots? We are just customers trying to dine at your establishment and we do not owe you anything. Will think twice about dining at this place again
Food was pretty good and service was very attentive. Just feel for the price you can get better food quality with more wow factor.  Nothing to really complain about as it's overall a good experience.

Serves a wide selection of tasty skewers (mostly chicken). There is a limited selection of regular dishes too -- the cheese and mushroom scallop was superb.

Some negatives: it seems you can only order sake by the bottle -- I wish they sold it by the carafe instead. On the day we went the service was a bit chaotic, we didn't get any skewers for an hour and they lost track of what they had already delivered to us. On the plus side, they were apologetic about this and gave us some free vegetable dishes to tide us over.

Can you believe that this place does not take bookings for Fridays and Saturdays because "the owner has booked it out". So I clarified: "you mean for the next week?" Nope - for the foreseeable future. I asked: "You mean for the next 12 months?"... "Yes but you're welcome to put your name on the waiting list". I hung up. These sorts of places don't want to earn my money obviously. What a joke of a place. And to think I used to like this restaurant...

This place is not any more what it use to be. Clueless servers, not good enough food quality & when we gave the feedback the manager was completely clueless with no response. Nothing !!! Nada!!! Guess just being overconfident on the past legacy

data.body: Among the plethora of Japanese restaurants in Cuppage, Kazu Sumiyaki stands out for its unassuming vibe and delish yakitori. Choose from a variety of meats like foie gras, pork belly and chicken wings, and some unique sticks such as zucchini and pancake balls. Before you know it, you would have savoured at least 20 skewers with your dining partner.
data.description: Japanese Cuisine
data.name: Kazu Sumiyaki

reviews.text: Good place for business lunches. Has a lot of sets to order from - something from everyone! Service is discreet, and food is reliably high quality

Made a reservation but due to Corona restrictions cancelled it on time for full refund. They were very fast to debit my credit card for full amount of more than 600 SGD but even after 5 calls and much frustration after 2 weeks funds have not been refunded. Excuses like they nee to communicate with the bank which is total nonsense. Also promises that they will call back never happened. Until now funds yet to be credited. There are a lot of good restaurants in Singapore to go to - don't go to Mikuni...

Disappointed.  Have been coming here for years but tonight was informed when we arrived that they only accept vaccination status verification using the app. Vaccination card as proof is not allowed. Could this have been conveyed to  the customer during the confirmation call prior to the booking? A wasted trip. Not coming here again!

First experience with Mikuni, my wife and I were blown away! Absolutely a must eat for people seeking delicious Japanese cuisine! My wife and I had the February Omakase dinner paired with a delicious sake! Every course was delicious and beautifully presented! With each dish that came out we thought that it was better than the last, but we were always surprised by how each dish kept ramping up in deliciousness! Absolutely would go back again to try out the rest of their menu! 100/10 would recommend!

It‚Äôs overpriced even we used Amex love dining 50% offer.

The food is under average and disappointed, especially the roll and cod fish. Service is okay. Not worth to try.

data.body: Be delighted with Mikuni‚Äôs multi-sensory dining experience complemented with signature creations and novel modern kaiseki dishes that seamlessly blend modern and century-old Japanese culinary techniques with a dash of theatrical humour.
data.description: Japanese restaurant at Fairmont Singapore
data.name: Mikuni

reviews.text: Randomly found this place but k love it. Delicious food and awesome environment!
We happened to try out this restaurant. Nice surprise as The food is really yummy and fresh out of the kitchen.

Great ambiance, excellent service, delicious food. A must visit place for anyone who loves authentic Japanese food. All the food we had were well seasoned and yummy. It really makes you feel that you‚Äôre dining at a quaint restaurant tucked away in an alley in Tokyo.

My mum chanced upon this restaurant while on one of her walks and decided to make a reservation to give the place a try. Safe to say we weren‚Äôt disappointed. Food was fantastic and the ambience was great. The staff there were friendly and helpful too! Will definitely go back again to try the other items on their menu. As the place is small, would recommend to anyone going there to make a reservation before hand to be safe.
Quite terrible service. Very rude staff with bad attitude. Price was reasonable.

data.body: An authentic Japanese restaurant with an extensive menu.
data.description: An authentic Japanese restaurant with an extensive menu.
data.name: Makan Koryouri

reviews.text: Was there with a friend on a weekday so no crowd. Do make reservations if you going on weekends. Soup base was really rich and flavourful. They have other side dishes to choose from to make up a set. They even have tatami seats to give you the Japan feel.

HOKKAI Butter Ramen is AMAZING!! the service staff are also really nice from entry to payment. They even asked if we enjoyed the food which of course we did!! Will surely come back!! Will be good if they gave us the option of where we wanna sit as we wear seated in an area where we had to remove our shoes. Would prefer to sit elsewhere and we get to keep our shoes on...

First time trying the food in this restaurant with my family.  Ordered Ichikokudo Shoyu Ramen. Wasn‚Äôt expecting anything from the food. Was just trying out.
The first taste of the broth immediately reminded me of the ramen I had in Japan. Exactly the same!!
Kudos to Chef Hannah and team. Thank you very much for wonderful flashbacks of my family‚Äôs Japan trip.

Excellent service, reasonably priced food that were delicious and of good quality ingredients. Would like to commend the waiter Joel at Northpoint City; he was very patient and goes above and beyond to accommodate to customer's requests and needs.
The food is great. The cleanliness is super clean. The service is great. Would definitely recommend this to everyone out there!!!

data.body: Halal-certified Japanese restaurant chain serving Hokkaido-style ramen.
data.description: Halal-certified Japanese restaurant chain serving Hokkaido-style ramen.
data.name: Zensho Ichikokudo

data.notes: Eve of & Public Holidays noon‚Äì11pm (Last order 10pm)

reviews.text:
Absolute worst Halal Japanese experience we had.

The next table to us left lots of food untouched. Troubled over which they even wanna try eating. They thought it was a real Japanese place based on the name.

What we had was horribly seasoned scallop sashimi, made my Muslim friends nauseous. They've had better sashimi grades.

Noodles soup base was bad too. Chicken was not brined, lacked flavor. It was a nightmare to finish the food as we wanted to not waste food.

Please don't call it Japanese food category when it's just imitation in looks and not taste. We have people who tried actual Japanese food for reference. Halal food providing the Muslim community with fake 'authentic' experience are really one of the worst.

We waited for more than 1 and half hour. Most of the food is salty. Some were great.
We can literally hear the conversation between the chef and waiter/waitress. The chef was not happy whenever we ask about our food.
Nice medium -cooked meat. They gave me free sparkling but the sparkling taste very weird. Nice and friendly staff.
Food was remarkable. Handmade sushi. Nice ambience of a traditional Japanese sitting arrangement. Will definitely come back!

First time being there, overall it was a great dining experience especially with in-house entertainment. Really appreciate how the magician made the act kind of special for us. Food was decent and extremely filling. I thought it had a nice atmosphere and decor, especially on the 2nd level which mimic the flooring and seating style.

data.body: Singapore‚Äôs first Muslim-owned Izakaya, HarƒÅru Izakaya specializes in Japanese charcoal-grilled items. The two-storey restaurant sports a traditional Japanese style interior with a tatami dining space on the second floor. Choose from charcoal grilled options such as the Surume Ika (S$17+), a grilled whole squid. The Kushiyaki sticks include the chicken thigh and leek skewers (S$5+), quail egg skewers (S$5+) and grilled diced beef with ponzu sauce skewers (S$8+). Those spoilt for choice can opt for the eight sticks skewers, an assortment of skewers for S$20+.
data.pricing: Prices of √° la carte menu varies
data.description: HarƒÅru Izakaya specializes in halal Japanese charcoal-grilled food.
data.name: HarƒÅru Izakaya

reviews.text: Had lunch with wife to celebrate her birthday. We were impressed with the food quality and service standard. Wife was happy with the meal and that says it all.

Service is normal.
Ordered the set lunch. Food here is okay. Not much presentation but good flavors. The truffle mushroom egg is the best. Wonderful and umami flavours of truffle and mushroom. Crab risotto is fine. For mains, the fish is much better then the beef. I think it's just not a good cut of the beef thus the meat is a little tough.

This place was cozy and had good atmosphere. All the dishes served by decent staff were beautiful and tasty. They have wide variety of Japanese sake which goes well with their food. I also love Premium malt‚Äôs which is Japanese beer I don‚Äôt see a lot in Singapore. I would say it‚Äôs suitable not only for special occasion, but also dropping by to get a few drinks with some small bites.
Service was good and the food was good quality esp the wagyu beef. Nice gestures for the birthday cake. Thank you:)

Had the 4-course which was advertised as omakase, but it was more of a set lunch where u choose which items u want from each section. Pretty sorely disappointed with the meal frm start to end. Start was a very difficult to eat salad, mains were just OK, and it ended with desserts of which main component was sliced raw tomatoes.. Left hungry. Service was great though. Just really disappointed with the food given the great reviews.

data.body: Situated in the busy Duxton Hill enclave, RIZU is a lively and intimate Japanese restaurant featuring a refreshing authentic modern Japanese dining concept from owner Hisamizu Takahashi. The traditional and contemporary Japanese menu is the result of the hard work by the team of highly skilled chefs who have been personally handpicked by Hisamizu. The native menu showcases a unique fish selection and ingredients that are specially flown in from Japan and other global regions. Each dish is artfully plated and presented before it leaves the kitchen. A wide selection of sake offerings alongside a simple wine and champagne list, and seamless service completes the personable gastronomic experience.
data.description: Sushi and modern Japanese cuisine in leafy Duxton Hill
data.name: RIZU

data.companyDisplayName: RESORTS WORLD AT SENTOSA PTE. LTD.

reviews.text:
Agree with many of the comments. They charge like fine dining, and there were some bright spots in the menu, like the Hal Yamashita Tokyo premium mini beef curry, which tasted pretty delicious. However, the restaurant was severely understaffed, a little small, and they had a very loud table of uncles speaking in Hokkien in the ‚Äúprivate room‚Äù right beside our table. Why have a ‚Äúprivate room‚Äù when there was just a wooden partition with holes in between?! Why sit a couple near to a table of loud uncles where there were so obviously other seats available in the restaurant?

And the problem is - we did reserve beforehand so not sure why we were subjected to such a disturbing experience. Hence I‚Äôll rate it a 3 - 4 for the food, 2 for the experience.
Had a wonderful time at Syun. Excellent service by Miyoko and team, food is fresh. Restaunt setting is warm and cosy...very inviting. Their signature dishes is simply amazing. A must try!
A well-tailored menu with incredibly fresh ingredients
The sashimi is super fresh!!

The attempts at trying to add a fusion twist to Japanese classics unfortunately didn‚Äôt pan out.

First of all, The staff and customer service at this restaurant was top notch. every single member of the staff was attentive and friendly.

If you‚Äôre coming for the Sushi and Sashimi then go for it.

The sushi and sashimi in this restaurant is very refined and delicious. the fish is fresh, the presentation is nice, and the wasabi is perfect. But the other menu items are dubious.

The miso soup is a ‚Äúfusion‚Äù miso soup that tastes more like Tonjiru Soup. On top of that, there are diced tomatoes inside. Tomatoes are used in western cuisine for Umami flavor but why use that when there are countless japanese ingredients that can provide that.

The Wagyu beef sushi roll was completely covered in sesame seeds, which masked the flavor of everything else inside. To top it off, when the roll was deconstructed I found kimchi inside. There was also arugula and cucumber which all come together weirdly. This roll seemed like a random mix of ingredients none of which paired each other.

The Miso Cod was another hit and miss. The miso glaze was well done but the chef decided to add parmesan cheese which was a strange combination and the result was a piece of Cod with melted cheese on top.

The menu also only included one pork item which the restaurant had sold out of. The chawanmushi was also sold out.

Overall definitely if you are only looking for raw fish. Otherwise, there are far better options and more reasonable prices in town.

data.body:
Fresh sushi, sashimi and exceptional meats are expertly fused together using contemporary Japanese and Western cooking techniques to bring out distinct yet complementary flavours. End the meal with sake exclusively brewed for the restaurant or rare Japanese whiskeys such as the Nikka Taketsuru 35 years.

Syun is located at Crockfords Tower Lobby, Resorts World Sentosa (RWS).
data.source: RESORTS WORLD AT SENTOSA PTE. LTD.
data.description: Syun will reawaken your senses and renew your perception of Japanese cuisine with its nouvelle interpretation of Japanese fine dining.
data.name: Syun (Resorts World Sentosa)

reviews.text:
Overpriced. Taste of the sauce is... Weird? Overall not sure why I want to go back for the food...

That being said, the staffs are great. Very attentive and warm toward our group.
Food was good, quality is good. The ambience was nice too. Enjoyed my meal, wished they had more drinks available.

Good decor and well mannered staff. Food was served rather quickly and portion sizes were decent. Interestingly, I really enjoyed the ‚Äúleaf‚Äù tempura (I think it may have been a mint leaf?) but all their items are pleasant. Wouldn‚Äôt mind returning
Tasty tempura that's reasonable priced for what you get. Like the small cozy no frills ambience. The spicy drizzle for the tendon was delish
The best tempura ever. The batter was light and remained crispy throughout the meal. Dipping sauce was just right.

data.body:
Situated on the third floor of Shaw Centre, along Scotts Road, Tenjin specialises in serving up satisfying bowls of tempura donburi (also known as tendon), where generous pieces of seafood and vegetable tempura are served atop a bed of fluffy Hoshi-Jirushi rice from the Ibaraki prefecture. 

Try the all-new Tempura Moriwase (S$24.80) which features a selection of premium ingredients such as anago (eel), crab leg, prawn and fish. Each set is accompanied with a warm house-made tentsuyu sauce and comes with a set of kyabetsu salad and miso soup. For something different, guests can change their Hoshi-Jirushi rice to Inaniwa Udon, which is served alongside with a house-made mentsuyu sauce.

Tendon is widely known as an accessible and well-loved Japanese dish, and the concept‚Äôs design pays homage to this with its minimalist interiors. Raw concrete walls give the place a clean and chic vibe, softened with the warm glow of bamboo pendant lights that add a cosy touch.
data.description: Tenjin, a name inspired by the much-loved Japanese tendon dish, is a smart-casual Japanese restaurant under the Les Amis Group that specialises in Tempura Donburi.
data.name: Tenjin (Shaw Centre, Orchard)

reviews.text:
Long wait time to be seated and again for the food. Good and friendly service made up for it.

The pancakes were definitely fluffier and less eggy than another one that I‚Äôve tried. However, it‚Äôs still way too expensive and the short dining time allocated (~40min) doesn‚Äôt justify the long wait time. If you‚Äôre looking for a place to linger for a while, come closer to the end of the night because they won‚Äôt kick you out if it‚Äôs the last seating.

Had the strawberry and cream pancake ,taste of the food was not bad.. but the wait for the food was way too long‚Ä¶ they‚Äôve set a dining time of 40 mins for each diner but it took them 25 minutes to prepare my order and the staff never alerted me about the wait.

22 August Sunday 6pm. There was a chef who was mixing the batter and cooking the pancakes. She is amazing!!! Definitely commendable focus and precision. Please tell her my many thanks and she's absolutely amazing. üíØ

Had the classic which was fine. The strawberry cheese came really undercooked so I asked them about it and they said they‚Äôll make a new one. New one also came undercooked. It was wet inside and tasted like eggs. I found it weird as the classic was perfectly fine but the next two were so badly undercooked. You could tell the inside was not cooked as it was wet and yellow compared to the outer edge which was soft but white and cooked. Wasted $14, didnt bother asking them to make another new one.

UPDATE: got  stomachache and this was the only thing that we had all eaten, emailed them no reply...

the high price of their dishes is not warranted when accounting for the quality of the topping. while the souffl√© pancake is tasty, both the mango and coconut toppings were severely disappointing. Both times we came here, the mango was not ripe and the coconut shavings we‚Äôre rubbery, hard & tasteless, clearly showing that the toppings were of low quality and freshness. i would say avoid the fruit pancakes, as we enjoyed the strawberry cheese

data.body: The name says it all: irresistibly fluffy, sweet Japanese pancakes that just melt in your mouth. Must-try: Mango-Passionfruit Souffle Pancakes.
data.description: Irresistibly fluffy, sweet Japanese pancakes that just melt in your mouth.
data.name: Fluff Stack

reviews.text: Food is worth the price! Ordered the mountain monster and was pleasantly surprised by the large portion given. Taste wise the food was good, staff was very attentive and professional. Will definitely bring my friends and come again next time!

The Food and drinks were really good and served fresh and hot.
Nice ambiance and they were careful with the safe distancing and sanitising.
Ash, the manager was very friendly and helpful as we're the other staff.
I will visit again
Been here a few times and service is amazing! The food never disappoints. Always hot and well-presented üëçüèº

First time here with my hubby, ordered the ramen monster combo. Almost got a heart attack when i saw the huge portion!!!ü§£ Environment and staff were very nice and safe distancing measures were good. Overall, worth the price and I would highly recommend this to anyone who is around the area!
person in charge was very friendly and patient ,even asked if the food was good ! love the customer service ,they did mix up my parfait but they were swift about making things correct

data.body: At Monster Planet, savour Japanese demi-glace curry made from 14 different vegetables and spices. Enjoy it with your choice of either Chicken Katsu, Shrimp Tempura, Fried Fish or Beef Shabu-Shabu served on a bed of Japanese rice topped with omelette and cheese.
data.description: At Monster Planet, savour Japanese demi-glace curry made from 14 different vegetables and spices.
data.name: Monster Planet

reviews.text:
I'm gonna give this place 5 stars.
What a fantastic cosy place!
Food was better than expected.
Staff lovely
Prices fair and quality and quantity well above average.
A great place for a casual date and place to go w friends.
Plenty of dishes to choose from.
Salad was generous and delicious!
This is a nice and cozy place to chill in. Potion of food is just nice and the service is good, keep refilling the drinks without the need to prompt the crew.
Solid 4 star, not too much of surprise but each dish tasted decent enough for this rating.
Will give 4 stars if food quality can be improved.

Been here after friend's recommendation , very nice ambient and great foods as well. The sashimi is very fresh especially love their salmon belly sashimi. The 'kongba' pau is also very nice and soft + tender. Overall a nice place to visit with friends and enjoy the great foods.

data.body: Snug, down-to-earth izakaya offering sushi & everyday Japanese fare, plus sake & beer.
data.description: Snug, down-to-earth izakaya offering sushi & everyday Japanese fare, plus sake & beer.
data.name: Box n Sticks

reviews.text: Food was alright. Sushi was average. Staff was friendly.

Auntie wouldn't let me eat inside because I was on my own? Tried to insist I eat outside, despite lots of empty tables inside? She couldn't speak English, so I left.

Think it was good when I tried before, but wouldn't make the trip again.
Nice broth

Went to The Ramen Stall on 31st January 2022. Was one of the first customers at around 11am plus. Very courteous service. The Volcano Ramen was delicious and really hit a spot. The sashimi was fresh and tender. The okonomiyaki was the best I have ever tasted. Such a fiesta in the mouth. Totally loved the whole experience.
Ramen is reasonably priced. Sushi was ok but could have had more varieties. Overall it's good taste and worth to go the  next time.

data.body: Halal Japanese restaurant serving painstakingly prepared food with no artificial flavourings.
data.description: Halal Japanese restaurant serving painstakingly prepared food with no artificial flavourings.
data.name: The Ramen Stall

reviews.text: A nice place to enjoy some Halal Yakiniku. We went during the 2-diners rules implementation during dinner time and we didn't had to wait long even (when we expected to wait to be seated). Nice ambience, food is good (value for money and worth it), nice staffs. Highly recommended if you want to enjoy meat and japanese food.

The BBQ beef was extremely good. Went with my wife, ordered 3 different plates of beef and a bowl of chicken cutlet rice. I have been telling my friends of their beef. Its a must try, at least once in your lifetime.

Ordered the 700g platter and it was superb üëåüèª. Especially with the different meat parts and cuts. Can't get enough of their kimchi too. It wasn't very pickled tasting but tasted very fresh and very well made. Definitely heading back for more üôåüèª

Very very awesome experience. The quality of beef is quite good and the price is also reasonable. And we liked the fact the staffs made an effort to be more personal by remembering our names. The service provided is also excellent. Highlu recommended!
Meat quality was superb. Service was top notch! They gave great recommendations and taught us the best way to eat yakiniku. Thanks Jamie and everyone of the crew! We'll be back for sure.

data.body: Singapore‚Äôs first halal Yakiniku restaurant, helmed by their Japanese chef from Hokkaido.
data.description: Singapore‚Äôs first halal Yakiniku restaurant, helmed by their Japanese chef from Hokkaido.
data.name: Waku Waku Yakiniku

reviews.text: The skewers is really nice! The beer also nice. I can drink 7 pints in one night.
Really delicious food and great service. Fantastic place to hang out and have a drink!

Had one of the best skewers in town. The pork belly, bacon wrapped cherry tomato and the ribeye beef skewers are my favourites. Very chill vibes all around, accompanied by the affordable drinks and mouth-watering food. Friendly boss that goes around ensuring his customers are doing alright.

Overall, great food, chill drinks and an amazing yakitori joint! Great place to bring friends to have just a quiet yet awesome time with food and drinks. Will definitely be back again for more!
Very good restaurant, all the employees are nice and young, definitely recommend this place especially for those who are interested in Yakitori

Me and my friends chanced upon this place after dinner to just chill. It happened to become one of my favourite place to hang out at! The staff and boss are very friendly and made us feel like home at the restaurant.

data.body: Inspired by Japanese izakayas, this skewer bar offers affordable food and alcohol.
data.description: Inspired by Japanese izakayas, this skewer bar offers affordable food and alcohol.
data.name: Sa Tae Bak Yakitori
